fields.description:
*Environment:*
* Confluence 5.6.3
* Team Calendar 5.0.5

When you click "License Configuration", Team Calendar will redirect you to the UPM, without any explanation.

If you're familiar with managing addons, then it's probably not a stretch to find Team Calendars in the list, and deal with the license appropriately.

If Team Calendars has a "License Configuration" tab, it should provide the ability to update the license from that tab; or explain what must be done to update the license in the UPM.

Given that this issue has occurred previously in TEAMCAL-413, it's raised as a bug - but could also be seen as an improvement request.

fields.description:
We are planning to upgrade Confluence to latest version 5.9.5. Mandate is we need to have Team Calendar 5.3.9+ to be compatible with this Wiki version.

With this annoying feature [TEAMCAL-3147|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TEAMCAL-3147], one has to have Wiki Space associated to given Calendar. (Can anyone tell me, why there should be relation, why can't we make it optional)

And the trouble is if we want to associate the Wiki Space with calendar, it just doesn't accept the Wiki Space name or Wiki Key. Wiki throws error saying "No Space Found". Quick investigation reveals that internally it uses rest api call like this

https://<wiki-instance>/rest/prototype/1/search/name.json?max-results=5&pageSize=5&type=spacedesc%2Cpersonalspacedesc&query=queryterm

As you can see, API calls searches in Space Description rather than Space Key or Space Name, which in my opinion is not set by most teams (at least that is the case in our company)

I've also confirmed that by updating space description, it does work. But the question why it's not very obvious in error description. or why not reterieve all three parameters (spacename, spacedesc and space name) and then make decision.

Hope this helps. 

Thank you,
Raju
fields.summary: Unable to enter required "Wiki Space" for Calendar

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Moving recurring calendar events using drag/drop functionality causes the event to appear on the wrong date when subscribing to the calendar using iCal. Duplicates can also be seen when importing/exporting the calendar in .ics format. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new calendar
# Create a recurring monthly event
# Drag/Drop the event to a different date (sometimes this needs to be done more than once)
# Subscribe to the calendar using iCal.

h3. Expected Results

Event dates match what is shown on Team Calendar

h3. Actual Results

Event dates are shown differently than what is shown in Team Calendar. The date is not always consistent with the date it was moved from. 

h3. Notes

The bug can not always be replicated. Sometimes the date will show correctly when imported, but it's not consistent. 

h3.Workaround

Delete the event and recreate it.
fields.summary: Importing calendar to iCal shows incorrect dates or duplicates after moving calendar event

h3. Summary

Confluence users that had previous subscribed to a calendar still receive notifications when calendar have new events added or when events in the subscribed calendar are modified even after their 'can use' permission has been revoked from the Confluence.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new user in Confluence. 
# Assign a group that are allow to use/login to Confluence (eg. confluence-users) to the user
# Make the new user watch a calendar in Team Calendar
# Remove the group membership from the user. (!) The user can no longer use the Confluence.
# # Modified or add a new event into the watched calendar

h3.  Expected Results

Confluence should not send notification to  users who are not permitted to use the Confluence

h3. Actual Results

Confluence process the notification and publish notification to non permitted user.

fields.description:
Hello!

When using default Holiday event problem is caused if someone else is entering holiday for you. For example in our case manager entered holidays for team members.

In Confluence person in question is shown correctly (even avatar in timeline mode) and there's no information shown who originally entered that event.

But when showing same calendar in Outlook actual person who is on holiday isn't shown at all. Instead, person who entered event is shown.

So this feature is quite useless for showing who's on holiday when looking from Outlook.

Most probably mapping of person used in Outlook and Team Calendars should be fixed? I guess now person field for Outlook is "originator" instead of "person who is on holiday". Like there is such assumption that everyone enters their holidays by themselves :-) 

Case is shown in attachments. Some entered their holidays by themselves and it's ok in Outlook. But I think it's still quite normal that someone else could enter whole team's holidays, for example in team meeting.

If it's just mapping those person fields, this should be quite easy to fix, right? :-)

Thanks!

BR,

Jarno
Confluence & JIRA Admin
fields.summary: Person who is on holiday is not showing correctly when Team Calendar is used from Outlook

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48544].
  {panel}

TL;DR - using {{java.util.TimeZone#getDefault}} is expressly forbidden, you must always use SAL {{TimeZoneManager#getDefaultTimeZone}}. There's some obvious instances in the TeamCal master repo right now that need to be fixed, but I suspect that iCal4j will also have a few ([~hunguyen] dug this up: https://github.com/ical4j/ical4j/search?utf8=✓&q=TimeZone.getDefault)

---

Instant-On will change the way system level timezones work. In the past, in a simpler, single tenanted time, it was acceptable to ask the JDK for the default time zone (via {{java.util.TimeZone#getDefault}}). However, this is no longer the case.

The problem is that Instant-On (and the full-blown multi-tenancy that it is a precursor to) results in a situation where the default timezone for the current tenant does not necessarily align with the default timezone of the underlying system itself.

Fortunately, SAL has always had {{TimeZoneManager#getDefaultTimeZone}} available, so porting should be relatively straightforward. TimeZoneManager has been around for quite a while, so it should be safe to assume it is present in the older versions of Confluence that TeamCal supports. In older versions, TimeZoneManager will simply lookup the timezone from the JDK. As of newer builds with the work I did for CONFDEV-27723 however, it's slightly more complicated. At any rate, you shouldn't need to care if you're using SAL TimeZoneManager exclusively to look up default time zones.

NOTE: This is currently a blocker for rolling the Instant-On project out to customers, hence the reason I raised this ticket with a Critical priority.
fields.summary: Change the way default time zone is determined

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Calendar search is performed with unconverted strings when adding multi byte name existing calendar to Team Calendar.

h3. Environment

* Confluence 5.x, 6.x
* Team Calendars 5.3.10, 6.0.14
* IE 11, Chrome, Safari, Firefox

h3. Steps to Reproduce

#  Add a team calendar
#  Add a new calendar with multi byte name (e.g. "テスト")
#  Add a existing calendar
#  Input Multi byte characters in a text box.
## Type "t" "e"  "e" "s" "u" "t" "o" in the text box (The inputted text should be "てすと" at the moment)
## Press _Space_ key to convert "てすと" to "テスト" and *immediately* after that, press _Enter_ key

h3. Expected Results

Calendar search is performed with converted multibyte strings.

h3. Actual Results

Calendar search is performed a search with unexpected strings which hasn't been converted yet.

 !calendar.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Note

IME is used for inputing multi byte characters.
Especially, Japanese IME converts alphabet to Japanese specific characters like Hiragana/Katakana/Kanji.

The converting procedure is as follows.

# All the typed alphabets are converted to Hiragana immediately
# Press _Space_ key to convert the Hiragana to Katakana/Kanji if needed
# Press _Enter_ key to commit the conversion 

When reproducing this problem, each type of browsers tends to send the search string to server in Step1.
Some type of browsers didn't send the search string to server in Step2.
All the browser never send the search string to server in Step3.

To make matters worse, pressing _Enter_ key in Step3 seems to cancel the key type event in Step2. That's why this problem could be reproduced in case we do Step2 and Step3 quickly.

These behavior is really unnatural to all the IME users. (not only for Japanese)

h3. Workaround

* Type a normal alphabet immediately after the inputted multibyte string (e.g. "テストa") and remove it (e.g. "テスト")
* Just past the whole multibyte string into the text box (It means inputting the string *without* IME)
fields.summary: Calendar search is performed with unconverted strings when adding multibyte calendar name calendar to Team Calendar

OR
* Downgrade to Team Calendar 5.3.9 by uninstalling the currently installed Team Calendar 5.3.10 and manually installing Team Calendar 5.3.9 by [file upload|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/UPM/Installing+add-ons#Installingadd-ons-Installingbyfileupload].
fields.summary: Unable to Share a page with Team Calendars in Chrome and IE

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48533].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The name of the user on "Who" field is not shown on events when the calendar is imported to another tool. This issue occurs only for events under the type _Events_ or any other custom event type.
h3. Environment
-
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a calendar on Team Calendars
# Click on 3 dots icon next to the calendar
# Click on _Subscribe_
# Copy the link
# Import the calendar 
#* [Subscribe to Google Calendars from Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEAMCAL/Subscribe+to+Google+Calendars+from+Confluence]
#* [Subscribe to Team Calendars from Microsoft Outlook|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEAMCAL/Subscribe+to+Team+Calendars+from+Microsoft+Outlook]

h3. Expected Results
The event should be shown in the same format it's shown on Team Calendar
!Screen Shot 2015-07-17 at 9.46.16 AM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results
The name of the user on "Who" field is not shown on events (custom types and _Events_ type) when the calendar is imported to another tool.
!Screen Shot 2015-07-17 at 9.46.28 AM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes
-
h3.Workaround
-
fields.summary: The name of the user on "Who" field is not shown on events when the calendar is imported to another tool

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48531].
  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce - Scenario 1* 

# Create calendar
# Add event
# Observe color of your event
# Log in as different user in different browser
# Locate the calendar and event
# Change color of the event
# Compare instances 
# Observe that color changed only for the second user. Original color remain unchanged

*Steps to reproduce - Scenario 2* 

# Create calendar
# Add event
# Observe color of your event
# Apply edit restrictions to yourself
# Log in as different user in different browser
# Locate the calendar and event
# Change color of the event
# "Error(s) occurred. Insufficient privileges for operation"

*Expected behavior*
If the color is changed only for the second user in scenario 1, why "edit" restrictions apply as well for changing the color?
fields.summary: Changing event color doesn't affect origin color but restrictions applied
we should add an additional space after event icons and change the time format of event

fields.description:
h5.Steps to Reproduce:
# Create a new Calendar
# Create an Event of the "Event" Type:
#* Set the "Who" to yourself
#* Set the "What" as "My Super Event"
# Create an Event of the "Travel" Type:
#* Set the "Who" to yourself
#* Set the "Summary" to "My Super Travel"
# Subscribe to the calendar in a third party program, such as Outlook or Thunderbird (with the Lightning Plugin)

h5.Expected Results
The calendar entries should be displayed identically to how they are displayed in Confluence Team Calendar. Given the example above, I see the following: 

!Teamcal.png!

h5.Actual Results
When the calendar is viewed in an external program, the generic event does not list the user(s) associated with the event:

!Screen Shot 2014-12-10 at 1.46.56 pm.png!

h5.Additional Notes
This problem will also affect custom event types that you create. This means that any event type that isn't one of the built-in event types will not display the contents of the "Who" field.
fields.summary: Generic and Custom Event Types display differently in third party applications

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Cannot add the event of JIRA project, which has multibyte project name, with JQL in TeamCalendars.

When user set the JQL "project = <project name with Japanese>", 
Error message 
 "Error occurred while validating JQL against [Your Company JIRA]." 
is displayed.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 5.9.12 + TeamCalendars for Confluence 5.3.11 + JIRA 7.1.8

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Integrated JIRA and Confluence 
# Create a project in JIRA with Japanese project name. ex) testテスト
# Add a calendar in a page in Confluence.
# Save the page.
# Add an event.
   Event Type: JIRA Issue Dates
   Name: <anything>
   Display: JQL
            "project = <JIRA Project name>"

h3. Expected Results

It is possible to add an event.

h3. Actual Results

It is not possible to add an event with an error message.
 !ErrorMSG.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
It was able to add an event with Confluence 5.8.9 + JIRA 6.2.7 + TeamCalendars 5.3.9

h3.Workaround
Create a filter in JIRA with same JQL. and set the filter as a Saved filter in Display of Create event.

fields.summary: Internationalization issues in TC 5.3

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When attempting to pring a calendar from My Calendar in Team Calendars, Chrome will attempt to print the calendar and associated calendar info on two pages instead of one. As Chrome does not give the option to resize or scale any of the content in the pages, this does not allow useres to print on the desired one page.

h3. Environment
* Chrome v.49

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to My Calendars
# Attempt to print

h3. Expected Results
Ideally the content would fit onto a single page.

h3. Actual Results
2 pages are used.
 
h3. Notes
This does not appear to be the behavior on other browsers.

h3.Workaround
Use another browser
fields.summary: Printing in Chrome defaults to 2 pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48512].
  {panel}

Go to "calendars" tab. 
Choose one of existing calendars, and open the menu.
From menu choose "Restrictions".
Choose "Restrict viewing" for one team member.
Press "Ok"
---

fields.description:
If you adjust the Start time in a range that uses a date field without time, the range increases incorrectly.

h5.Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field type called "PlannedStart"
# Create a new issue that uses this custom field, and:
## Set the "Due Date" to "15/01/2015" (15th Jan 2015)
## Set the "PlannedStart" to "13/01/2015" (13th Jan 2015)
# Display a date range for this issue in Team Calendar
# Edit the range, and set the start time to the previous day (12th Jan 2015)

h5.Expected Results
The range should be from the 12th of Jan 2015 to the 15th of Jan 2015. Only fields in the JIRA ticket that are changed should be updated (in this case, the field used at the start of the range should change to the 12th).

h5. Actual results
Both the start date and the end date of the ranges are adjusted. In the case of the start date, it will correctly update to the 12th of January 2015 (both in the calendar and the ticket).

The date used for the end of the range (in this case "Due Date" is updated to have an incorrect value, despite the value not changing and being uneditable in the Team Calendar UI. It remains unchanged in the JIRA ticket.

This is somewhat confusing, so here's the process in screen shots:

First, here's the issue and it's dates:
!StartDates.png|thumbnail!

Next, we'll create a range for this issue:
!IncorrectRange1.png|thumbnail!

Then, edit the start date of the range. Note that the end date is not editable, and does not change from the 15th of January:
!EditDate1.png|thumbnail!

The event changes it's start date, but the date is pushed to the 16th, and displaying as the 17th:

!IncorrectRange2.png|thumbnail!

Editing the issue by even an hour will cause the range to increase in time again: 

!EditDate2.png|thumbnail!
!IncorrectRange3.png|thumbnail!

When the end of the range increases beyond what was originally set, it will be updated on the JIRA ticket. In this case, when the range stretched to the 17th, the date was updated on the ticket as the 16th:

!UpdatedDates.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Adjusting the start time for a JIRA Event Range using a Date field increases the range

fields.description:
We use a confluence team calendar on order to organize our teams' on-call-duties.

Now, we do see duplicate entries in this calendar-subscription on iPhones or Macs - probably due to calendar entries using a repetition interval.

Here's an example: 

In week 29 user "Mario Kröger" is on duty, as correctly displayed in confluence teamcalender (see screenshot "Confluence-calender MK.png").
Looking at the calender-subscription on my iPhone, I can see that both "Mario Kröger" AND "Alexander Dransfeld" are on duty (see screenshot "iPhone Calender AD MK.png").

We suppose that the reason is that Alex Dransfeld's entry uses a repetition-interval (every 5 weeks - see screenshot "repetition interval AD.png").
Actaully Mario and Alexender switched their on-duty-shifts and the calendar entries have been "corrected"/deleted manually.

Nonetheless does the subscription still show the "old" entry of Alex' shift, though the confluence-gui shows the correct entries...
fields.summary: Duplicate/old entries in calendar subscription (on iPhone or Mac)

  {panel}

h3. Summary

When embedding a Team Calendar on a page, it prevents the page from being moved.  An error is received "Move failed. There was a problem contacting the server."

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Confluence page with no restrictions.
# Edit the page.
# Click Insert > Team Calendar > Add New Calendar > Save
# Attempt to move the page. 

h3. Expected Results

The page moves to the location selected.

h3. Actual Results

An error is received in the UI: "Move failed. There was a problem contacting the server." and the page does not move.

The below exception is thrown in the Google Chrome console.
{noformat}
http://localhost:8596/confluence/pages/movepage.action?spaceKey=MYS&targetT…=append&atl_token=f0d8c59ef53e5b5ad29b2c4845a01288dd3f735f&_=1458599493651 Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 403 (Forbidden)
{noformat}

h3. Notes

The error is independent of space/page restrictions as it can't be moved within the same space.
Tested in Confluence 5.8.18 and 5.9.6

h3.Workaround

Downgrade to [Team Calendar 5.3.9|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/download/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.extra.team-calendars/version/2240]:
fields.summary: Team Calendar embedded on a Confluence page prevents it from being moved

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Team Calendars are configured to display JIRA data. Making a change to a JIRA issue in JIRA is never reflected in Team Calendars unless the calendar is manually refreshed or Confluence's cache is cleared. Changes also do not get pushed through to  external subscription feeds. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a calendar in Confluence. 
# Add a new JIRA event using the 'Event Type' - JIRA Issue Date.
# Select Project and an applicable Project in the Display drop-down list. 
# Select all check boxes under Single Date:
# In JIRA, make a change to the Due Date on one of the existing issues. 
# Wait

h3. Expected Results
The calendar will update within 1 hour.

h3. Actual Results
The calendar never updates. 

h3.Workaround (only available for Confluence server)
# Go to !https://s3.amazonaws.com/uploads.hipchat.com/10804/2041359/oZYNLidcDNI3S8o/Dashboard%20-%20Confluence%202015-05-13%2013-43-47.png!  > General Configuration > Cache Management.
# Choose *Show Advanced View*.
# For all Team Calendar caches, click the *Adjust Size* link and change the 'Maximum elements' to *1*.
# Click Submit.

The following caches are available:
* Team Calendars - iCal subscription sub-calendar data
* Team Calendars - JIRA Agile Sprints sub-calendar events	
* Team Calendars - JIRA connection drag drop support	
* Team Calendars - JIRA Project Release sub-calendar events	
* Team Calendars - JIRA sub-calendar data (old)	
* Team Calendars - JIRA sub-calendar events	
* Team Calendars - JIRA sub-calendars	
* Team Calendars - User preferences
fields.summary: Changes to JIRA issues never synchronize to Team Calendars without manually refreshing the calendar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48483].
  {panel}

As you can see on https://zipkin.atlassian.io/traces/352e5b2b2c21229f , TC is making 39 requests to the Media API for the exact same file.

Transcription from HC:

{quote}
[11:33 AM] Eduardo Garcia [Atlassian]: so it's asking for the same icon ~30 times?
[11:34 AM] Eduardo Garcia [Atlassian]: is it possible to cache that somehow, at least for the same call? (which is what we're seeing here)
[11:41 AM] Richard Atkins [Atlassian]: I'm still trying to see where the rest resource inlines any attachments, rather than just generating links to them
[11:41 AM] Richard Atkins [Atlassian]: (because browsers are great at ensuring they only retrieve a link once)
[11:41 AM] Eduardo Garcia [Atlassian]: yeah :D
[11:41 AM] Eduardo Garcia [Atlassian]: although for that to work, you probably need a signed url
[11:41 AM] Eduardo Garcia [Atlassian]: but in any case, that'd be better, yes
[11:42 AM] Richard Atkins [Atlassian]: com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.rest.resources.EventResource#getEvents(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String) is the entry point for that rest request
[11:42 AM] Eduardo Garcia [Atlassian]: or using something like VCache or whatever to cache the icons for a while, if the probability of them being repeated is high
[11:42 AM] Eduardo Garcia [Atlassian]: we can also do some kind of caching in our side at some point, but it's a lot more involved of course :)
[11:48 AM] Richard Atkins [Atlassian]: I'm not seeing anything that would cause a rest request to have an inlined attachment of any kind. Have you been able to reproduce this on any test env?
[11:49 AM] Richard Atkins [Atlassian]: What I am seeing is that reminder notifications (and other notification types) will inline images, but that's only when generating emails
[11:50 AM] Richard Atkins [Atlassian]: What sort of zipkin trace header integration was created for the jobs triggered by the external job scheduler?
[11:50 AM] Richard Atkins [Atlassian]: are they triggered through rest requests, or through SQS?
[11:51 AM] Richard Atkins [Atlassian]: Because it all feels like we're looking in the wrong place
[11:54 AM] Richard Atkins [Atlassian]: hmmmmm, maybe not
[11:54 AM] Richard Atkins [Atlassian]: any time DefaultResourceDataHandler.createAttachmentDataHandler is called, it reads all the bytes in the relevant attachment
[11:55 AM] Richard Atkins [Atlassian]: and that *could* be being called on rest requests, even when that DataHandler is subsequently not used for anything
[11:56 AM] Richard Atkins [Atlassian]: that's all as a side effect of invoking com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.event.transformers.SubCalendarEventSupportingInviteesTransformer#transform
[11:59 AM] Richard Atkins [Atlassian]: It looks like that Transformer will only trigger the problem if there is precisely one invitee for the event that's being sent. If there are more, then we'll just append the names of the invitees (sounds like bad ux)
[11:59 AM] Richard Atkins [Atlassian]: Looks like you're getting 30 requests for the same file because you're retrieving 30 events with the same user
[12:00 PM] Richard Atkins [Atlassian]: You'll be happy to know that switching to Aa managed avatars will probably make this problem go away for you
[12:02 PM] Richard Atkins [Atlassian]: of course, it will also *break* in that case, because it assumes that all profile pictures are still managed by Confluence's AttachmentManager
[12:11 PM] Richard Atkins [Atlassian]: @DuyLuong which issue tracker should @Edu  raise a bug in?
[12:12 PM] Richard Atkins [Atlassian]: Looks like we can fix an ugly performance and memory problem at the same time, simply by making the Transformer (or DataHandler) aware that it's rendering for REST vs a notification
[12:13 PM] Richard Atkins [Atlassian]: (notification ==> inline any Avatar that isn't external)
[12:13 PM] Richard Atkins [Atlassian]: And at the same time, we can fix the bug where external avatars will cause NPEs or worse
[12:14 PM] Richard Atkins [Atlassian]: Just because a ProfilePictureInfo has a downloadPath, it doesn't mean that path is inside Confluence
[12:15 PM] Richard Atkins [Atlassian]: I'm assuming that there's another team taking care of the Cloud side of the TeamCal fork...
{quote}
fields.summary: TC is making too many requests to the Media API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48471].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When you click the *Create* button in Confluence, you'll see the option of creating a calendar even if Team Calendars is not enabled for your instance (_see calendar1_ and _calendar2_). This is confusing because it will not allow users to enter the data during the creation process (_calendar3_) and there's no warning message. If you click *Cancel* and click on *Add Calendar* (see _calendar4_) nothing happens. Again there's no error message.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Confluence, click on *Create > Calendar > Add new calendar*
# Try to enter the information, the fields are greyed out and editing is not possible. 
# Click *Cancel*
# Click on *Add Calendar*, nothing happens

h3. Expected Results
If Team Calendars is not enabled, you'd see a notification that you need to activate it first. Or directly, don't see the option to create calendars in the menu.

h3. Actual Results
You can proceed normally but at the end no calendar can be created.
fields.summary: Option to create a calendar showing in menu when Team Calendars is disabled

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48470].
  {panel}

Hello Atlassians,

one of our scrum masters recently created a new team calendar. He embedded it in Confluence and all events, leaves etc. were shown. Then he communicated to a team member to embedd the calender as well but after finding the calender in the Confluence Macro, it embedds as a subscribtion. I as a Confluence admin tried to reproduce this with the same result. The calender only embedds as an subscribtion. I asked the scrum master to delete the calender from the macro and embedd it again, and it looks like he can also just get a subscribtion.

Any idea why this could be?

Kind regards,
Chris

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48467].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description:
When an anonymous user attempts to hide a calendar, the calendar is hidden as expected but a 401 error message is also presented to the user:
{quote}
401 - Client must be authenticated to access this resource.
{quote}

While this is not a major issue since it doesn't hinder functionality, a fix would be nice. 
This error message is misleading for end users. The error can lead some users to either believe that something went wrong and doubt whether their action completed. Or worse gradually have them accept the bug as part of the software.

This problem is still happening on the latest Team Calendar version even after installing JIRA iCalendar 1.1.1:

h3. Environment:
JIRA v6.3.1 
Confluence v5.5.6
Team Calendars v4.4.5
JIRA iCalendar v1.1.1

h3. Steps to Replicate
# Install JIRA and Confluence and integrate them with Application Links using OAuth (2-Legged).
# Create a project in JIRA (e.g. Demonstration Project)
# Grant 'Anyone' browse permission to the project
# Create a space in Confluence (e.g. Demonstration Space)
# Grant anonymous access to Confluence (general)
# Grant anonymous access to your Demonstration Space.
# Add some data to the Demonstration Project (e.g. due dates / sprints / release dates).
# Add a Team Calendar (e.g. Team Calendar Anon) on a page in the Confluence Demonstration Space (it should display correctly).
# Log out of Confluence
# Click on the 'Confuence' logo to begin using Confluence anonymously.
# Navigate to the page you created containing the calendar.
# The informtion from JIRA is displayed correctly.
# Clicking on the link to hide an Event:
!team_calendar.png|width="70%" height="70%"!
# The error below is displayed:
!tc_error.png|width="80%" height="80%"!
fields.summary: Anonymous users get 401 error when hiding calendars from macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48465].
{panel}

{panel:title=23 July 2019 Update|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi everyone, thank you for your interest in this ticket. After carefully reviewing it, we have decided that this is not a bug. To explain why, we need to understand how team calendars works. We have calendars, which have their own permissions, which are associated with one space. In a space's calendar view, you can add a bunch of existing calendars. According to this ticket, when a user is in this view, they should be restricted by what they can do based on where they are viewing the calendars from. In reality each calendar has its own permissions. It may make sense for each calendar to respect the individual space permissions for the space that it is associated with. I'm raising a suggestion that a view like this (which is made up of several calendars) should take into account edit permissions. This is tracked here: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-58616

Thanks for your understanding.

Regards,
Niraj Bhawnani
Senior Development Team Lead, Confluence Server
{panel}

Steps to replicate :
 # Login to Confluence
 # Create a new calendar and tie it to the space named "TEST"
 # Create a new group named "confluence-test"
 # Create a user named testing and add it to "confluence-test"
 # Now grant space view permission for that individual user to the user named testing via {{Space tools >> Permissions}}
 # Login as the newly create user named "testing" and access the "TEST" space Calendar section.

*Current Result* : The user is able to add new or import a calendar

*Expected Result* : The user should not be able to add new calendar since they *only* have view permission.
fields.summary: If user is restricted to only view the space they should not be able to create or import a calendar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48460].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# install Confluence 5.9.4
# install Team Calendar 5.3.10
# create a page
# insert calendar into the page
# access Confluence using Google Chrome and click on the star icon to mark the page as Favourite

h3. Expected Behaviour
Page will be mark as favourite

h3. Actual Behaviour
*Server error while updating favourite* is thrown as shown below
 !ERROR.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Diagnosis
Temporary disable Team Calendar via Administrations > Manage Add-ons > disable Team Calendar and then try to reproduce the problem. If the problem is no longer reproducible in the same Google Chrome browser, you are affected by this bug.

In addition to that, there is *400 Bad Request* can be found in the Chrome's Developer Tool.

h3. Notes:
This is *not* reproducible in:
* Firefox  for any of the version OR 
* Confluence 5.8.x with Team Calendar 5.3.4 OR 
* Confluence 5.9.6 with Team Calendar 5.3.9

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48458].
  {panel}

After plugin update to version 5.3.11, the table columns of the calendar view (months' view) don't expand when page is loaded. The columns appear "compressed" and overlapping (see attachments ...compressed1+2.jpg). So it seems as if the dynamic width adjustment does not work properly. 

In our setting, the parameter "width" in calendar makro is not set (calendar should fill 100% of width), but the issue also appears when width is set to a fixed value.

I've tried in Mozilla Firefox 47.0 and Chrome 51.
We're using RefinedWiki theme, but the issue is the same with documentation theme.

Workaround: After clicking forward to next month, the calender view expands and calendar is displayed correctly.

How can we fix this?
If you need any other information, please let me know.

Thank you in advance!

Best Regards
Tanja
fields.summary: Calendar table (month) does not expand on page load

fields.description:
We set up a recurring event in Team Calendar. I have subscribed the calendar in Outlook. Since a few weeks, I get the attached error message (in German language) which says:
There is a VEVENT in the subscribed calendar with the timezone setting TZID value "Europe/Berlin" which is not declared.

I tried to analyse this and exported and downloaded the ics file directly from our Team Calendar. Here are the most relevant lines:

BEGIN:VCALENDAR
PRODID:-//Atlassian Confluence//Calendar Plugin 1.0//EN
VERSION:2.0
CALSCALE:GREGORIAN
X-WR-CALNAME:exensio
X-WR-CALDESC:
X-WR-TIMEZONE:Europe/Berlin

fields.description:
h3. Description:
Whenever an iframe (html macro with iframe, but also Adaptvist CFP iframe) is added to a page with a calendar, the calendar view is only showing the first row or presenting all calendar entries in a single broken column.

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a Calendar with a month full of events on it (the more, the better).
# In the same page, put an iFrame on it loading an external content (tested with a Google Spreadsheet).
# Save the page -> no need for extra content.

h3. Expected:
The page loads the external content in the iFrame and the Calendar as well.

h3. Actual:
The content is loaded just fine for the iFrame, but the Calendar appears completely broken in the layout.
!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround:
h4. Workaround a: 
Resize the browser window (restore, then maximize), causes the calendar to display normally.
h4. Workaround b:
Click to change the Calendar month view and then get back to the previous month.
fields.summary: Calendar view limited to 1 row or column when iframe is used on same page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48450].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
In the Team Calendars *My Calendars* page users can no longer add existing calendars to their primary list on the right-hand side of the page. From the [Team Calendars documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/teamcal/team-calendars-quick-tour-241566246.html], users can add an existing calendar using the arrow dropdown next to *Add calendar*:
{quote}
To get started, you'll need to create a calendar or add an existing one. Hit Add Calendar to quickly create a new calendar, or use the down arrow to the right of it to add an existing calendar in the following ways:

Add Existing Calendar – to subscribe to another calendar in your Confluence instance.
Import Calendar – to import an ICS file.
Subscribe by URL – to subscribe to a Google Calendar using its URL.
{quote}


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login to a Confluence instance that has Team Calendars installed.
# Click on {{Calendars}} at the top of the page.
# Click on the arrow dropdown to the right of {{Add Calendar}}. 

h3. Expected Results
A dropdown should appear with options to add an array of calendars, as shown in this screenshot:
!tcoptions.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results
Clicking the dropdown only allows you to create a new calendar, as displayed in this screenshot:
!create_calendar.png|thumbnail!
This is displayed in the development console when clicking on the dropdown:
!tc_console.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
This issue occurs in version 5.3.10-D20151229T094001 in Cloud and cannot be reproduced in 5.3.10 Server version. 

h3.Workaround
Currently there is no workaround.
fields.summary: Cannot add calendars to My Calendars page

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce
*Scenario 1*
# Login to Confluence
# Install Team Calendar
# Click on "Calendars" on the top navigation bar
# Click on Add Calendar on the top right and add a calendar called "test"
# Create a new events called "testing recurring event" and set it to Repeat weekly as per the screenshot below :
!recurringEvent1.jpg|thumbnail!
after that click OK
# Select on the recurring events and click on Edit as per the screenshot below :
!editRecurringEvent.jpg|thumbnail!
# Add admin user to the "Who" field as per the screenshot below :
!editRecurringEvent2.jpg|thumbnail!
then Click OK
# click on another recurring event and add test user to the "Who" field as per the screenshot below :
!editRecurringEvent3.jpg|thumbnail!
!editRecurringEvent4.jpg|thumbnail!
# Now go back to the first event that have the admin user added in the "Who" field as per the screenshot below and edit the text to "testing recurring event 2". Please ensure that the "Edit this instance only" is unticked :
!editRecurringEvent5.jpg|thumbnail!
!editRecurringEvent7.jpg|thumbnail!

*Current result* : the first event does not show "testing recurring event 2". It seems that other recurring event is showing the changes but not the event that have user test added to the "Who" field as you can see from the screenshot below :
!changes1.jpg|thumbnail!

*Expected result* : the first event should show the changes along with all the recurring events.

Steps to reproduce
*Scenario 2*
# Login to Confluence
# Click on "Calendar" on the top navigation bar
# Add a new Calendar named test2
# Add event on test2 calendar named "test recurring event" and ensure that Repeat is set to Weekly
# Click one of the events to edit and add user "admin" to the "Who" field. Ensuring that "Edit this instance only" is ticked
# Click on the same event to edit and add user "test" to the "Who" field. Ensuring that "Edit this instance only" is unticked.

*Current result* : the recurring event that we have edited shows that only "admin" is in the "Who" list while others show the changes that was made as per the screenshot below :
!recurrentEvent.jpg|thumbnail!

*Expected Result* : All recurring event should show the changes including one of the recurring event that we have made changes to.

*Scenario 3*
# Create a recurring weekly event
 !Screen Shot 2020-02-18 at 17.09.42.png|thumbnail! 
# Edit one specific instance of this recurring event
 !Screen Shot 2020-02-18 at 17.10.14.png|thumbnail! 
# Add a user on the "Who" field (with "Edit this instance only" enabled)
 !Screen Shot 2020-02-18 at 17.10.37.png|thumbnail! 
# The following day's event will switch to the same day as the edited event:
 !Screen Shot 2020-02-18 at 17.11.01.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48442].
  {panel}

I subscribed to a team calendar within Mac Calendar, but the subscription stopped updating. Turns out the subscription URL is broken, and returns a 400 error: "The request sent by the client was syntactically incorrect.". So I went to Confluence to get a new subscription URL, but the field is blank.

h4. Steps to reproduce:

# Go to "My Calendars" within Confluence
# Click "…" next to the calendar name in the right sidebar.
# Click "Subscribe"

h4. Expected results:

You should see an .ics subscription URL in the modal window's input field

h4. Actual results:

* The field is blank. (See screenshot)
* The JS console reports "Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 500 (Internal Server Error)" for a request to "https://avvojira.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/calendar-services/1.0/calendar/subcalendar/privateurl/1c31d896-1906-4231-bf07-ec750601aa50?_=1452554155052"
* {{mycalendar.action:1}} returns an error: "Uncaught SyntaxError: Unexpected token <"


I also tried "Export to iCalendar", which did work (but won't update when the team calendar is updated).
fields.summary: Unable to fetch calendar subscription URL

fields.description:
This is a regression from [this bug report|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TEAMCAL-3043], which is now happening with the following setup:

Version: Confluence 5.10
Team Calendars version: 5.3.11
Timezone for Calendar: America/Sao_Paulo

However, this time, when trying to create an event at October 16th (which will be the daylight savings start day of this year: http://www.timeanddate.com/time/change/brazil/brasilia), we will get the message:

bq.Value 0 for hourOfDay is not supported: Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (daylight savings time 'gap'): 2016-10-16T00:00:00.000 (America/Sao_Paulo)
fields.summary: Daylight saving time gap on Team Calendar (Regression)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48436].
  {panel}

No matter which Application link method was used Jira releases are not made visible to anonymous users. 

I created a user with viewing rights to the releases, and if I log in using that user I can see the releases (in jira and Confluence), so the users permissions are correct.

I switched the outgoing application link from confluence to jira to use Basic Access only using this user, since i couldn't figure out another way to expose the releases that are private on Jira publically on Confluence. 

I'm expecting to see the releases publically in the calender macro, but I get Jira JQL errors saying nothing was returned.
fields.summary: Jira releases not visible to anonymous users
Users receive notifications for calendars they don't watch

fields.description:
*How to Replicate The Bug*

* Create a new Team Calendar Macro inside a page
* Configure the "Legend" of the calendar to be located in the bottom of the calendar
* Create (i) or (!) macro just right below the calendar
* Save the page

Due to the above configuration, Confluence Team Calendar macro cut the legend drop down in the middle as we can see in the screenshot below:

!teamcal.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Calendar Legend Drop Down Menu is Cut When it Located in The Bottom

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48431].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When removing all events from a Team Calendar of a specific event type, the event type remains in the Event Types Legend. 

h3. Environment
Team Calendars 5.3.11



h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new event that does not show up in the Event Type Legend
# The event should appear on the calendar with the corresponding event type displaying in the Event Type Legend
# Delete your event from the calendar


h3. Expected Results

The event type should automatically be removed from the Event Type Legend or there should be an option to remove the event type


h3. Actual Results

The event type remains on the Event Type Legend and there is no option to remove it


h3.Workaround

There is no current workaround
fields.summary: Event type remains after all events of that type are removed from a Team Calendar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48430].
  {panel}

I added an event to a calendar. After that I edited the event and tried to add a weekly repetition, ending on 26.10.2015 (selected the date from the date picker).

After clicking OK I get an error telling me that the date format is wrong (showing the exact same date format as entered).

(German localization)

After selecting the date in the date picker, the edit box flashes the message "Formatierung" ("formatting" or possibly "format").
Entering date manually does not help.
fields.summary: Cannot set a weekly repetition for an event

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unable to delete a Custom Calendar Event

h3. Environment
* Team Calendar 5.3.10

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new [custom event|https://confluence.atlassian.com/teamcal/custom-event-types-659785408.html]
 # Create event with the newly created event type, set it as recurring
 # Delete some/all of the events

h3. Expected Results
Events deleted

h3. Actual Results
Unable to delete event, getting the following error message:
{noformat}
An error occurred while trying to delete event 20171010T225744Z--76744798@confluence.abc-dev.net.au.
{noformat}

h3. Notes
The issue seems to happen sporadically, but sometimes more often in others. Has been replicated in Chrome, FF and Safari. 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Custom Event Types Not Deleting (Single or series)

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When editing JIRA related events with a user who is *NOT* the creator of it, a project in the top of the drop-down is set as the default value.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 5.9.5
* JIRA Software 7.1.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an application link between Confluence and JIRA
# Create two *Scrum software development* projects on JIRA
#* One project of them is named as *test1*
#* The other project is named as *test2*
# Create and Start a sprint on the each project
# Login to Confluence with *User A*
## Create a calendar on Confluence
## Add *JIRA Agile Sprints* event to the calendar and set *test2* project on it
# Login to Confluence with *User B*
## Open the event edit dialog

h3. Expected Results

Even if *User B* opens the event edit dialog, *test2* project should be selected as the default value in the project selecting drop-down.
 !test2_selected.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

When *User B* opened the event edit dialog, *test1* project was selected as the default value even though the current project was set to *test2*. (*test1* is in the top in the drop-down.)
 !test1_selected.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

* When it comes to *User A*, the drop-down behaved as the expected result
* The same issue happened when it comes to *JIRA Project Releases* event
fields.summary: When editing JIRA related events, a project in the top of the drop-down is set as the default value

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement
Repeating events showing 1 hour difference before and after the DST change when Google/Yahoo calendar subscribes Team Calendar.

h3. Steps to replicate

# Set your Confluence timezone to {{(GMT+0100) Amsterdam, Berlin, Bern, Rome, Stockholm, Vienna}}
# Create a calendar in Team Calendar with the timezone (Europe/Vienna +0100)
# Go to October 2015, create a daily repeating event with time before 25th of October and ends at 31st of October.
# Note that Team Calendar shows all the repeating events at the same time.
# Right click the calendar and click subscribe and copy the link.
# Go to your Google/Yahoo calendar and set your timezone to Vienna (GMT+1). Under the "other calendar" add the URL and wait for it to load.
# You will find that the events before 25th October displays the time correctly. Events after 25th will show 1 hour earlier.

h3. Important things to note
# DST for Vienna ends at 25th October
# This only happens for repeating events
fields.summary: Daylight saving time causing 1 hour difference between Team Calendar with other calendars (Google, Yahoo)
Invalid date-time error for a valid time
